title: Polynomial Regression Model
polyDegree: The degree of the polynomial equation. Must be less than the number of unique data points
comparePolyModelsChk: Compute additional Polynomial models to compare
addlPolyDegrees: Specify one or more degrees to create multiple Polynomial models (e.g. 3, 4, 5)

help.title: Polynomial Regression Model
help.body:
Description
This dialog is used to compute and fit an orthogonal polynomial model with specified degree
using lm(response ~ poly(a predictor, degree), data = dataset)

In addition to help(poly, package ='stats'), check the following R help pages
help(anova, package ='stats') - used for comparing poly models with different degrees
help(AIC, package ='stats') - used for computing AIC for comparing poly models
help(BIC, package ='stats') - used for computing BIC for comparing poly models

help(cars, package ='datasets') - A good reference where lm() and poly() are used together

You can try this dialog by loading dataset cars from Load Datasets menu
Choose dist as dependent variable and speed as independent variable
